title: Besides being an amazing and highly successful author, what can we learn from J.K. Rowling? - Quora

response.answer_text: Never mess with your book universe. Once you write the story, you can, of course, share info that doesn’t contradict canon, but keep your reimaginings either quiet or make an alternate universe series;Do your research. The moment when your story becomes a literature sensation, prepare for fans to scrutinize the story down to the tiniest of details and pick apart the tiniest of plot holes;Never approve derivative works as ‘canon’ stories if they are as believable as a crappy fanfic;Allow your book series to rest in peace. Once it’s done, it’s done. Don’t release pandering trivia that nobody asked for just to stay relevant;Respect your fans. If your fans believed a certain fact about your stories and you want to disprove it, then, for God’s sake, don’t say stuff like: ‘I’ve never said that [insert your fact here] is correct/incorrect, etc.’ Do your corrections politely;If you plan to make a website to enrich your universe, then by all means do so. Just make sure that you don’t put articles like ‘15 times someone did something’. Those belong in a fan website. Make your written text easily accessible and completely separate from any update pages and merch sales pages. Allow comments on the site (with moderations, of course. Trolls should be reported and blocked after a few cease and desist warnings). Add interractive elements for your fans to be entertained by, but don’t overdo it.

She never gave up — when she was at her lowest ebb she wrote and wrote and wrote. I find that extremely courageous and admirable. And maybe a bit crazy however a certain amount of craziness is necessary (I think) for writers who produce such a large volume of work in a relatively short period of time.
How to make millions by taking ideas from superior previous works, adding a few tweaks and some shoddy worldbuilding, and then watching the money roll in.
How to organise a backstory and an outline. You need to make your world real.
